intro: Sida confusa, commonly known as the woolly sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture. Sida confusa is characterized by its stellate (star-shaped) trichomes, which give the plant a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and roadsides.
